title: save: does not add/commit subds which replaces a symlink
body:
<details>
<summary>reproducer</summary> 

```shell
#!/bin/bash

export PS4='> '

set -eu
set -x

cd "$(mktemp -d ${TMPDIR:-/tmp}/dl-ssh-XXXXXXX)"

datalad create subds  # will later be moved

datalad create ds
cd ds

ln -s /broken subds
datalad save -m "adding symlink" subds

git status

# remove symlink and replace with proper subds
rm subds; mv ../subds .

datalad save -d . subds

git status

```
</details>

ends with

```
...
> datalad save -d . subds
> git status                                                                                                            
On branch master                                                                                                        
Changes not staged for commit:
  (use "git add <file>..." to update what will be committed)
  (use "git restore <file>..." to discard changes in working directory)
	typechange: subds (new commits)

no changes added to commit (use "git add" and/or "git commit -a")
bash save-subds.sh  5.36s user 1.90s system 106% cpu 6.817 total

```

note that it also does it silently and without any feedback to the user

```shell
$> datalad --version
datalad 0.14.0.dev10
```
